item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, October 31, 2024 at 3:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Generative AI Scripting (140 points | 32 comments)
2. OpenZFS deduplication is good now and you shouldn't use it (168 points | 92 comments)
3. It might be possible to detect gravitons after all (79 points | 20 comments)
4. Chain-of-thought can hurt performance on tasks where thinking makes humans worse (185 points | 83 comments)
5. Wonder Animation – Video to 3D Animation (48 points | 4 comments)
6. AI Flame Graphs (195 points | 60 comments)
7. Typing fast is not so important (10 points | 3 comments)
8. The History Of The Monokai Color Scheme (9 points | discuss)
9. Steam games will need to disclose kernel-level anti-cheat on store pages (494 points | 310 comments)
10. Cerebras Trains Llama Models to Leap over GPUs (18 points | 5 comments)
11. Crafting Painterly Shaders (121 points | 3 comments)
12. SimpleQA (133 points | 39 comments)
13. FDA Permits Marketing of Digital Game to Improve Attention in ADHD Children (14 points | 2 comments)
14. Google CEO says more than a quarter of the company's new code is created by AI (284 points | 466 comments)
15. I Attended Google's Creator Conversation Event, and It Turned into a Funeral (76 points | 16 comments)
16. A comparison of Rust's borrow checker to the one in C# (31 points | 8 comments)
17. Show HN: G-win – .gcode parser written in Rust with winnow (23 points | 2 comments)
18. Show HN: AI OmniGen – AI Image Generator with Consistent Visuals (106 points | 26 comments)
19. Pushing the frontiers of audio generation (174 points | 70 comments)
20. Rubocop-obsession: RuboCop extension focused on higher-level concepts (65 points | 22 comments)
21. An Italian 'fruit detective' who investigates centuries-old paintings (50 points | 9 comments)
22. Show HN: Ezcrypt – A file encryption tool (simple, strong, public domain) (35 points | 37 comments)
23. M4 MacBook Pro (701 points | 969 comments)
24. Launch HN: FlyCode (YC S22) – Stop losing revenue due to failed payments (74 points | 55 comments)
25. Google's TOS doesn't eliminate a user's Fourth Amendment rights, judge rules [pdf] (283 points | 205 comments)
26. Infisical (YC W23) is hiring full stack engineers (remote or in SF) ( | hide)
27. 1BRC Coding Challenge: Nerd Sniping the Java Community (122 points | 34 comments)
28. DeepSeek v2.5 – open-source LLM comparable to GPT-4, but 95% less expensive (134 points | 36 comments)
29. Australia/Lord_Howe is the weirdest timezone (958 points | 395 comments)
30. Show HN: LlamaPReview – AI GitHub PR reviewer that learns your codebase (82 points | 26 comments)
